I expected junk for this price, honestly. I expected fake polarizing filter over cheap plastic lenses, I expected lots of plastic and loose hardware. Couldn't be happier though to be wrong.  The polarization is for real, besides the fact that you can immediately see colors more vibrantly and less sun glare, it comes with a tester card that makes it obvious. And the build quality on these seems to be punching well above it's price tag, they're solid and sturdy. I'm not saying these are designer glasses quality, but often real polarizing sunglasses from a mediocre brand can run you $100. Whereas these cost like $5 each. What a steal.
Great fitting glasses & easy to adjust. A great deal at the price. Definately recommend these.

I was looking for some stylish sunglasses like ones I had in the 80's. These weren't 100% on point, but pretty close, so I gave them a shot. I am very pleased with them. They seem a decent quality, and are optically very sharp. The polarized lenses do make my cell phone screen look weird, but I'll get used to it. Worth noting that the green lenses are so dark that they almost look black.
